Course_Name: MA UPWP1 - Landscape Planning and Society - Summer term 2024

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lecture next Tuesday, Evaluation, last task

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, next Tuesday we're going to have another guest lecture on the practical relevance of societal issues for a planning office. We also will do a brief evaluation on the course, consisting of four questions (see ISIS). You can already do it now, but there will also be time next Tuesday, I just would like you to think about what has been good, what bad and which suggestions you have to improve the course. Please bring your laptop next week. If time allows I will give a presentation on neo-colonialism and nature conservation (ca. 45 min). Your last task will be a kind of reflection of the entire course by thinking about four main take-home messages  (see screenshot). Deadline: 28.7. Wish you a good remaining week, see you on Tuesday, Stefan Heiland

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Questions on Results of Task C2 (incl. amendments Prof. Heiland)

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, below the results my presentations C3-1 and C3-2 and your results of Task C2 you can now find an etherpad. You can ask questions there, if something should not be clear to you - and if you want. See you next Tuesday, Stefan Heiland  ar

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, just in case I should forget tomorrow ( ;-) ) and some of you might not be able to attend, here's the task for next Monday, May 6th, 11.00 a.m. Regards, hope to see (most of) you tomorrow, Stefan Heiland Graded Task C1 (15 pts) until Monday, 06.05., 11.00 a.m. Imagine you would have to develop a model to explain individual pro-environmental behavior. Which factors, that influence or determinate behavior, does it include and how are these factors related to each other? Give an overview, using keywords (no long explanations, no long text), simple flow-charts or similar means. Upload your results to ISIS “Graded Task C1” in Section “C. Pro-Environmental Behavior”

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Course Participation and Graded Task for next week

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, all those who were present today or who had previously apologised for the first lecture can participate in the course (see updated list of participants), if they register on MTS until 19.4.  There are still five places available, which will be exclusively given to students who attend the second lecture next week. This also applies to students who have registered but did not turn up today without being excused (you are not on the preliminary list anymore). For those who intend to come next week, please be aware of the graded task for next week. See Presentaton "Understanding of and human relations to Nature - Overview/Summary" last slide  and "Task A1: Quiz" on ISIS. Best regards, Stefan Heiland

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, find attached (and on ISIS) the preliminary list of participants. All who registred and fulfill ther required conditions are on the list (and one student on the waiting list). May I ask those of you who have filled in "Recognition as" with "Other" to send me an e-mail (stefan.heiland@tu-berlin.de) detailizing what exactly is meant by that? As to the further procedure: If you definitely want to participate attend to the first meeting next week (Tuesday, 9.00 a.m., Room EB 222) or let me know if there are any important reasons preventing you from doing so. Otherwise, your place may be allocated to students on the waiting list or those who have not yet registered. Looking forward to seeing you next week, best regards, Stefan Heiland

Discussions.Discussion_Name: IMPORTANT: Fill in registration form by April 7th

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, in addition to yesterday's mail from Mrs Krause with the reminder to register for the compulsory elective courses: More than 30 students have self-enroled on the course "Landscape Planning and Society" on ISIS, but only about 20 have done the additional mandatory separate registration via the registration form. You will find this "Registration form" in the first section on ISIS, with the relevant information (now in red - hardly to overlook) above it. Once again: Self-enrolment on the ISIS course is not sufficient. For the list of participating students, I will only consider those who have registered for the course. There will be no exceptions, there has been more than enough information on that from different sides. If you have not yet done so, please fill in the registration form by this Sunday, 7 April at the latest. I also have to add that the course is offered to Bachelor "ÖKUP" students in the "Profilierungsphase" that starts at 5th or 6th semester. Therefore I can't accept Bachelor students 2nd and 4th semester. Sorry for that. You will find the preliminary list of participants on the ISIS website by 12 April, but probably much earlier (next Monday or Tuesday). Best regards, have a nice weekend, Stefan Heiland

Messages.Author: Stefan Heiland
Messages.Content: Dear students, If you intend to attend the course you have to pre-register by filling in the registration from on ISIS until April 7th!!  Just inscribing yourself to the course is not enough!  Final registration according to the following procedure: Expression of interest and pre-registration for a mandatory-elective course (“WP course”): until 07.04. pre-registration for the relevant course on the ISIS platform (see form below) preliminary list of module participants including a waiting list will be published on the ISIS page on 12.04. Places are allocated during the first meeting of the semester (16.04.24), only to candidates on the provisional list who are present or excused In order to take the place in the course, a binding registration for the exam in MTS is required by the end of the first week of the lecture period. --> until 19.04.: registration on MTS!!! Any places not taken will be filled via the list of students waiting or those present in the second week of the lecture period. -->until 26.04.24: registration on MTS by students from the waiting list Regards, Stefan Heiland
